Welcome to Surikatz’s documentation!¶

Indices and tables¶

  • Index

Module main¶

class surikatz.__main__.ScanMode(value)¶

An enumeration.

surikatz.__main__.launch(target, level)¶

Launch of the Surikatz program

Args:

target: IP address or domain name of the target level: program launch level (passive, discret, agressive)

surikatz.__main__.motd(version)¶

Display of the Surikatz launch

Args:

version: version number of the Surikatz program

Module osint¶

Module for using OSINT tools and databases to perform passives scans

class surikatz.osint.IHaveBeenPawn¶

Class allowing the manipulation of I Have Been Pawn API

class surikatz.osint.OWASPfavicon¶

Class allowing the identification of website information with favicon

class surikatz.osint.PwnDB¶

Class allowing the manipulation of PawnDB database

class surikatz.osint.Rapid7¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Rapid7 API/database

class surikatz.osint.SearchSploit¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Searchsploit tool and Exploit-DB database and the parsing of its output

class surikatz.osint.ShodanUtils(key: str)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Shodan API

Attributes:

self: Shodan object. key: API key for Shodan.

get_data(target: str) → dict¶

Collect and generate data from databases

Args:

target: Device’s IP to target

Returns:

A dictionnary with all revelant information

class surikatz.osint.TheHarvester(domain: str)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of The Harvester tool and the parsing of its output

Attributes:

self: TheHarvester object. domain: domain name. For example : blabla.fr

get_data() → dict¶

Returns data found by TheHarvester

Args:

self: TheHarvester object.

Returns:

A dict of list. For example :

{“emails”: [admissions@blabla.fr, admin@blabla.fr, jean.dupond@blabla.fr], “ips”: [6.23.128.1, 6.23.128.2, 134.1.1.2, 134.1.1.6, 10.10.1.2, 128.2.2.1], “FQDN”: [vpn.blabla.fr, test200.blabla.fr, www.blabla.fr]}

Raises:

AppNotInstalled: Please install theHarvester on your device or use a Kali Linux.

class surikatz.osint.Wappalyser(key: str)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Wappalyser and the parsing of its output

Attributes:

self: Wappalyser object key: API key for Wappalyser

lookup(target: str) → dict¶

Function for finding out the technology stack of any website, such as the CMS or ecommerce platform.

Args:

target: Device’s FQDN to target

Returns:

data: Dict of technology stack of the target

class surikatz.osint.Whois¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Whois service provide by registars

whoIs(target: str) → dict¶

Whois function get information about an Ip address or a domain name

Args:

target: The IP address or the domain name

Return:

A dictionnary of Whois information

Module scan¶

Module for performing several scans

class surikatz.scan.HTTrak(target: str, path: str)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of HTTrack and the parsing of its output

Attributes:

target: IP address or doamin name of the target path: path where save result

class surikatz.scan.Nikto(target: str, path: pathlib.Path)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Nikto and the parsing of its output

Attributes:

target: domain name or IP address of the target

class surikatz.scan.Nmap¶

Class allowing the manipulation of nmap and the parsing of its output

start_nmap(target: str, args: str, timeout: int) → None¶

Launch the nmap command according to what has been put in parameter

Args:

target: domain nam or IP address of the target args: parameter(s) we want to put in the nmap command timeout: timeout parameter if we want use it for the nmap command

class surikatz.scan.OpenVAS¶

Class allowing the manipulation of OpenVAS and the parsing of its output

class surikatz.scan.Wafwoof(target: str, path: pathlib.Path)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of WafW00f and the parsing of its output

Attributes:

target: domain name or IP address of the target path: path in which the file will be saved

class surikatz.scan.WpScan(domain: str, key: str, wapplayzer_dict: dict)¶

Class allowing to get more information about Wordpress vulnerabilities

Attributes:

self: WpScan object. domain: A string representing the domain name to analyze. For example : blabla.fr key: A string representing the WpScan API Key available at https://wpscan.com/ wapplayzer_dict: A python dict representing Wappalizer result

Returns:

A dict containing wpscan passive part and wpscan aggressive|discret part

aggressive_wp_scan() → None¶

Allows to use wp_scan tool which returns the Wordpress website vulnerabilities with aggressive arguments. Write the output (wpscan.json) and it’s cleaned version (wpscan_clean.json) in a file at /tmp/surikatz/<date>

dict_concatenate() → dict¶

Function wich concatenate passive and aggressive/discret dict

Returns:

final_dict: Final dict containing all dict

discret_wp_scan() → None¶

Allows to use wp_scan tool which returns the Wordpress website vulnerabilities with discret arguments. Write the output (wpscan.json) and it’s cleaned version (wpscan_clean.json) in a file at /tmp/surikatz/<date>

passive_wp_scan() → dict¶

Passive WpScan analyze wich call WpScan API for every Wordpress plugins and themes contained in wappalyzer dict

Returns:

wappalyzer_vuln: a dict containing WpScan API call from wappalyzer containing plugins and theme

Module enumeration¶

Module for perform some kind of enumeration on an information system

class surikatz.enumeration.DirSearch(ip: str)¶

Class allowing the manipulation of DirBuster for Website enumeration and the parsing of its output

Attributes:

self: DirSearch object. ip: ip adress. For example : 10.10.0.1

get_data(path: str) → list¶

Returns data found by DirSearch

Args:

self: DirSearch object.

Returns:

A list of urls. For example :

[’http://blabla.fr:80/admin’, ‘http://blabla.fr:80/admin/passwd.txt’, ‘http://blabla.fr:80/js/app.js’, ‘http://blabla.fr:80/index.html’]

Raises:

AppNotInstalled: Please install DirSearch on your device.

class surikatz.enumeration.Kerbrut¶

Class allowing the manipulation of Kerbrut for Kerberos enumeration and the parsing of its output

class surikatz.enumeration.LDAP¶

Class allowing the enumeration of LDAP directory

class surikatz.enumeration.SMBMap¶

Class allowing the manipulation of SMBMap for SMB enumeration and the parsing of its output

Module utils¶

class surikatz.utils.APIClient(basic_url, key=None, proxies=None)¶

A class that will be used for gathering information from any API.

Attributes:

basic_url: URL on which we want to make an API request key: API key if needed proxies: proxies address

make_url_params(params: dict) → str¶

A function that create a string that will return an URL link for accesssing any API

Args:

result: a dictionnary that will contain the parameters that we must add to the URL in order to access the ressources

Returns:

A string character that will represent an URL link for accesssing the ressources of an API

request(target: str, params=None) → dict¶

General-purpose function to create web requests to any API.

Args:

target: The endpoint for accessing the ressources we aim for. params: dictionary of parameters for the function

Returns

A dictionary containing the function’s results.

class surikatz.utils.Checker¶

A class that is mainly used for checking and verification parts that will be useful for the smooth running of the operation.

static check_domain(domain: str) → bool¶

Function allowing to check if a domain name have a correct form

Args:

domain: The domain name to check

Returns:

A boolean

static check_ip_address(Ip: str) → bool¶

Function allowing to check if an Ip have a correct form

Args:

Ip: The IP address to check

Returns:

A boolean

static check_ip_public() → None¶

A function that will check and return our public IP address through the Ipify’s

static check_kali() → None¶

A function that will check if the OS used is a Kali Linux distribution

Raises:

OSError: an exception if you do not have a Kali Linux Distribution

static check_time() → None¶

A function that will check and return the date and the time when we run our program

static get_target(target: str) → str¶

Get target IP address or domain name

Args:

target: IP address or domain name

Returns:

domain: return domain name

static service_exists(name: str, data: dict) → bool¶

Check if service is in data

Args:

name: name of service (http, ssh, …) data: data from the dictionary

Returns:

boolean

class surikatz.utils.ConfManager¶
Class that has 3 main roles

  • check if a config already exists, otherwise it will generate it

  • check if the surikatz folder in /tmp exists, otherwise it will create it

  • read the config file, and complete it with the API keys

conf_exists() → None¶

Check if a config already exists

get_shodan_key() → str¶

Get Shodan API key

Returns:

SHODAN_API: API key for Shodan

get_wappalyzer_key() → str¶

Get Wappalyzer API key

Returns:

WAPPALYZER_API: API key for Wappalyzer

get_wpscan_key() → str¶

Get WPScan API key

Returns:

WPSCAN_API: API key for WPScan

Module result¶

Module for manipulate the final JSON output obtained by the previous scans to extract remarkable information

class surikatz.result.Analyze¶

Class for analysing the JSON, compare and eliminate obsolete data

static analyse_nmap(result: dict) → dict¶

Parse nmap result in order to extract

Args:

result: raw result of nmap scan

Returns:

Return a dictionnary containing for each host port its state, name of the product, version, cpe and protocol

static clean_dict(global_dict: dict) → dict¶

Clean dict data

Args:

global_dict: All concatenated data in python dict form

Returns:

global_dict: Cleaned dictionary

static get_clean_data_dirsearch(parsed_data: list) → list¶

Get clean data for DirSearch and Display them.

Args:

parsed_data: DirSearch parsed data.

Return a list of 10 first element of dirsearch data

static get_clean_data_theHarvester(theharvester_data: dict) → tuple¶

Get clean data for TheHarvester and Display them.

Args:

parsed_data: TheHarvester parsed data.

Returns:

A tuple containing a dict and a list of int

static get_cvss(cve: str) → dict¶

Retrieves information of a CVE

Args:

cve: CVE ID

Returns:

Return a dictionnary with for one CVE, its ID, its CVSS score and its type

static save_to_csv(dict_to_save: dict) → None¶

Transform dict data to a csv file

Args:

dict_to_save: All concatenated data in python dict form

static save_to_json(dict_to_save: dict) → None¶

Transform dict data to a json file

Args:

dict_to_save: All concatenated data in python dict form

class surikatz.result.Display¶

Class for determining revelant information for pentest

static display_CVSS(cve: str) → None¶

Display a CVE ID, CVSS score and type.

Args:

cve: Information of a CVE

static display_Dirsearch_data(dirsearch_data: list)¶

Display DirSearch cleaned data.

Args:

dirsearch_data: DirSearch cleaned data.

static display_json(path: str)¶

Display json file

Args:

path: path of the json file to be diplayed

static display_theharvester_data(theharvester_data: dict, lens: list)¶

Display DirSearch cleaned data.

Args:

theharvester_data: TheHarvester cleaned data. lens : Length of of each list [len(ips), len(emails), len(fqdns)]

static display_txt(path: str)¶

Display txt file

Args:

path: path of the text file to be diplayed

Module error¶

Module with custom Exception classes

exception surikatz.error.APIError¶

Exception generated when an API is unreachable

exception surikatz.error.AppNotInstalled¶

Exception generated when an app isn’t installed on the user device

exception surikatz.error.FQDNError¶

Exception generated when an FQDN address is misformed

exception surikatz.error.IPError¶

Exception generated when an IP address is misformed

exception surikatz.error.ReadError¶

Exception generated when an API is unreachable
